title: Tres Leches Cake Recipe
description: Try this tres leches cake recipe for a sweet and delicious dessert! A light sponge cake soaks up three types of milk and is frosted with whipped cream.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Tres Leches Cake 4.6 (395) 299 Reviews 101 Photos This tres leches cake recipe is one to try for a sweet and delicious treat! It's a part-dry, part-moist Mexican cake made with three types of milk. Submitted by Monica Jimenez Updated on December 3, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 101 101 101 101 Prep Time: 25 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Additional Time: 1 hr 20 mins Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 9-inch cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings Cake: cooking spray with flour 1 cup white sugar, divided 5 large eggs, separated, divided 1 cup all-purpose flour ⅓ cup milk 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Filling and Topping: 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 1 pint heavy whipping cream, divided 10 maraschino cherries Directions Make the cake: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9-inch springform pan with floured cooking spray. Beat 3/4 cup sugar and egg yolks in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until light in color and doubled in volume. Stir in flour, milk, baking powder, and vanilla. Beat egg whites in a glass or metal bowl until soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, continuing to beat until medium peaks form. Fold 1/3 of the egg white mixture into the egg yolk mixture to lighten it. Fold in remaining egg whites, then pour batter into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a cake tester inserted into the middle comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Loosen the edges with a knife, then remove the sides. Let cake cool completely on the wire rack, about 20 more minutes. Invert cake onto a deep serving plate and remove the pan bottom. Pierce the cake all over with a two-pronged meat fork or a cake tester. Make the filling and topping: Mix condensed milk, evaporated milk, and 1/4 cup whipping cream together in a bowl. Measure 1 cup milk mixture and refrigerate for another use. Slowly pour remaining milk mixture over the cake until absorbed. Pour remaining whipping cream into a chilled glass or metal bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until it thickens and reaches spreading consistency. Spread whipped cream over cake and garnish with cherries. If not serving immediately, refrigerate until ready to serve. I Made It Print 683 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Tres Leches Cake 01 of 101 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 101 Photo by  myon 09/27/2022 Very easy to make. Delicious. Only thing i would change is adding a bit of sugar to the whipped cream to make it a bit sweeter, if it has no sugar its a little sour. I put dulce de leche on mine as a topping to make it a cuatro leches. 03 of 101 Photo by  Antony Castro 05/10/2021 I loved this recipe! It’s so easy and delicious! 04 of 101 Photo by  Antony Castro 05/10/2021 I loved this recipe! It’s so easy and delicious! 05 of 101 Photo by  A Mosely 03/28/2021 06 of 101 Photo by  Paul French 02/02/2021 07 of 101 Photo by  Jessi Auyeung 12/18/2020 08 of 101 Photo by  Tyler Perez 12/08/2020 09 of 101 Photo by  robert tattenbaum 10/09/2020 10 of 101 Photo by  Fabiola 09/09/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Tres Leches (Milk Cake) 1,847 Ratings Tres Leches Cake (Three Milks Cake) 106 Ratings Tres Leches Cake with Dulce de Leche 3 Ratings Pastel de Tres Leches (Three Milk Cake) 122 Ratings Mexican Tres Leches Cake (Pastel de 3 Leches) 1 Rating G's Tres Leches Cake 53 Ratings 3 Milk Cake or Tres Leches 49 Ratings White Tres Leches Cake 23 Ratings Impossible Cake 107 Ratings Tres Leches Piña Colada Cake 61 Ratings How to Make Tres Leches Cake 78 Ratings Sweet Mexican Corn Cake 7 Ratings Key Lime Cookie Cake Sopapilla Cheesecake 323 Ratings Original Mexican Flan Napolitano 3 Ratings Margarita Cake with Key Lime Cream Cheese Frosting 101 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Monica Jimenez
instructions: Make the cake: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9-inch springform pan with floured cooking spray.;Beat 3/4 cup sugar and egg yolks in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until light in color and doubled in volume. Stir in flour, milk, baking powder, and vanilla.;Beat egg whites in a glass or metal bowl until soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, continuing to beat until medium peaks form. Fold 1/3 of the egg white mixture into the egg yolk mixture to lighten it. Fold in remaining egg whites, then pour batter into the prepared pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until a cake tester inserted into the middle comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Loosen the edges with a knife, then remove the sides. Let cake cool completely on the wire rack, about 20 more minutes.;Invert cake onto a deep serving plate and remove the pan bottom. Pierce the cake all over with a two-pronged meat fork or a cake tester.;Make the filling and topping: Mix condensed milk, evaporated milk, and 1/4 cup whipping cream together in a bowl. Measure 1 cup milk mixture and refrigerate for another use. Slowly pour remaining milk mixture over the cake until absorbed.;Pour remaining whipping cream into a chilled glass or metal bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until it thickens and reaches spreading consistency. Spread whipped cream over cake and garnish with cherries.;If not serving immediately, refrigerate until ready to serve.
